services.name: Shorten
services.description: Reduces the length of by taking from the bottom hem.

questions.question: Does your skirt have any unique details?
questions.explainer: Does your skirt have zips along the hem, ruffles or any details that will need to be removed and re-attached to complete this?

services.name: Waist in
services.description: Takes in the waist of your Trousers to remove any gapping.

subservices.name: Take in waist band (0-1 inch only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by tightening the waistband only.

subservices.name: Take in through centre back (0-2 inch only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist and seat by adjusting the centre back seam. This brings the pockets closer together, and in some cases the central seam won't stay perfectly straight.

value.filename: Suit trousers centre back waist in.webp

subservices.name: Take in waist from sides
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by taking in from the side seams at the back, leaving the central seam straight. This is limited by the amount of space between the seams and back pockets as a small gap will need to be maintained.

subservices.name: Take in waist through centre back and sides seams
subservices.description: Using a combination of waist-in options, we will balance the garment by taking in through both the sides and centre back. This methods allows for more to be taken out the waist of your jeans without compromising the structure.

subservices.name: Take in waist through darts
subservices.description: This methods provides more curve to the seat area. This will leave two dart lines on the back of your jeans underneath where the pockets sit.

services.name: Lengthen
services.description: Extending the length, using the existing seam allowance or adding a panel to the hem.

questions.question: Is there seam allowance at the hem?
questions.explainer: If the hem is folded and finished with a top stitch there is usually about an inch seam allowance to use.

subservices.name: Add panel to hem
subservices.description: We can lengthen by as much as you would like by adding a panel of fabric at any length you would like

subservices.name: Lengthen using existing seam allowance
subservices.description: We can discretely increase the lengthen by using the existing seam allowance. We can only lengthen as much as the seam allowance gives this is usually MAX AN INCH. There is often small holes where the previous stitch line was but these will dafe with wear and washes.

services.name: Up-size
services.description: Increase the waist band or leg width by adding a panel in your desired area

subservices.name: Up-size the waist
subservices.description: Adding a panel of material to the waist band, in a contrasting or matching fabric colour. We recommend to send in a matched item of the same style and fabric for our tailors to match the measurements t

questions.question: What material would you like for the panel?
questions.explainer: We can either use material you supply or use what we have in the studio. This can be a close match in terms of material colour and fabric or a contrast colour.

subservices.name: Up-size the sides
subservices.description: Adding a panel of material to the side seams, in a contrasting or matching fabric colour. We recommend to send in a matched item of the same style and fabric for our tailors to match the measurements to.

questions.question: What material would you like for the panels?
questions.explainer: We can either use material you supply or use what we have in the studio. This can be a close match in terms of material colour and fabric or a contrast colour.

services.name: Visibly darn holes
services.description: Fix holes using our darning technique

questions.question: How many holes would you like mending?
What is the average size of your holes?

services.name: Fix crotch
services.description: Repairing the worn-out material of your trousers

questions.question: What is the size of the problem
questions.explainer: Please give the average size of the material deterioration / holes / rips. Please measure from the widest part.

subservices.name: Patch [on top]
subservices.description: We can create a discreet patch using excess material from the inner part of the sleeve or pockets. Or alternatively we can use a close match material if there is not excess material in your garment.

subservices.name: Patching [machine darning]
subservices.description: We can use a machine darning technique to reinforce the area of material deterioration

subservices.name: Create discrete seam
subservices.description: We can pull a small rip/ hole into a small seam leaving a line where the material has been taken in to find the damage.

subservices.name: Panel replacement
subservices.description: We will remove the worn down fabric and replace it in a triangular shape with a close match fabric from our studio

services.name: Re-weave holes
services.description: Fix holes using swiss darning technique

questions.question: How many holes would you like mending?
Are your trousers patterned?
questions.explainer: Patterned trousers make Swiss Darning more complex as we try and replicate a similar pattern in our repair

questions.question: What is the average size of your hole/s?

services.name: Zip replacement
services.description: Ideal for when your zipper is damaged, stuck or no longer functions correctly. We have a stock of standard zips and can not guarantee an exact match to the original.

services.name: Fix loose stitching
services.description: Repairs seams or stitches that have come undone or are loose. Ideal for when the thread holding the fabric together is damaged, loose, or has unraveled.

questions.question: How many belt loops need fixing?

services.name: Re-weave holes - contrast colour
services.description: Fix holes using swiss darning technique

questions.question: How many holes would you like mending?
Are your trousers patterned?
questions.explainer: Patterned trousers make Swiss Darning more complex as we try and replicate a similar pattern in our repair

questions.question: What is the average size of your hole/s?
What contrast colour would you like for your repair?

services.name: Visibly darn holes - contrast colour
services.description: Fix holes using our darning technique

questions.question: How many holes would you like mending?
Are your trousers patterned?
questions.explainer: When visibly darning pattered trousers we will try and use a couple of different yarn colours to do a repair that is closer to the patterns design if possible

questions.question: What is the average size of your holes?
What contrast colour would you like for your repair?

services.name: Shorten
services.description: Reduces the length of by taking from the bottom hem.

questions.question: Are your trousers tapered?
questions.explainer: To check if your trousers are tapered, fold the bottom half up to just below the knee. If the ankle area is narrower than the knee area, they are tapered.

option.answer: No my trousers are not tapered

questions.question: Do your trousers have any unique details?
questions.explainer: Do your trousers have zips along the hem, ruffles or any details that will need to be removed and re-attached to complete this?

services.name: Waist in
services.description: Takes in the waist of your Trousers to remove any gapping.

subservices.name: Take in waist band (0-1 inch only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by tightening the waistband only.

subservices.name: Take in through centre back (0-2 inch only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist and seat by adjusting the centre back seam. This brings the pockets closer together, and in some cases the central seam won't stay perfectly straight.

value.filename: Suit trousers centre back waist in.webp

subservices.name: Take in waist from sides
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by taking in from the side seams at the back, leaving the central seam straight. This is limited by the amount of space between the seams and back pockets as a small gap will need to be maintained.

subservices.name: Take in waist through centre back and sides seams
subservices.description: Using a combination of waist-in options, we will balance the garment by taking in through both the sides and centre back. This methods allows for more to be taken out the waist of your jeans without compromising the structure.

subservices.name: Take in waist through darts
subservices.description: This methods provides more curve to the seat area. This will leave two dart lines on the back of your jeans underneath where the pockets sit.

subservices.name: Take in waist using combination
subservices.description: Take in waist through the centre back seam, sides and darts. Using a combination of all methods is ideal for those requiring more than 3 inches taken out the waist. Allows for a balanced structure as well as shape in the seat area.

services.name: Narrow legs
services.description: Slimming the width of each leg by taking them in from the outer side seams, starting from hips or knee down to the hem.

subservices.name: Taper from knee to hem
subservices.description: Slimming the width of each leg by taking them in from the outer side seams, starting from the knee down to the hem.

subservices.name: Taper from pocket to hem
subservices.description: Slimming the width of each leg by taking them in from the outer side seams, starting from hips down to the hem. Please keep in mind if the waist of your jeans are baggy this service will not take in the waist too. Please add this as service.

questions.question: Does your skirt have lining?
questions.explainer: When a garment has a lining, we will need to adjust the lining first before altering the outer fabric. This process requires additional time to ensure a seamless and professional finish

questions.question: Is your skirt pleated?
questions.explainer: The pleats in your skirt might not align as they did before depending on how much you would like taking in.

services.name: Waist in
services.description: Narrows the width of your skirt at the wastline to achieve a more fitted and flattering look. In most cases we recommend altering by a maximum of 2 sizes to maintain the original garment structure, this is usually by a maximum of 3 inches.

subservices.name: Take in waist band (0-1 inch only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by tightening the waistband only.

subservices.name: Take in through centre back (0-2 inch only)
subservices.description: Takes in the waist and seat by adjusting the centre back seam. In some cases the central seam won't stay perfectly straight.

subservices.name: Take in waist from sides
subservices.description: Takes in the waist by taking in from the side seams, leaving the central seam straight. This is limited by the amount of space between the seams and back pockets as a small gap will need to be maintained.

subservices.name: Take in waist through centre back and sides seams
subservices.description: Using a combination of waist-in options, we will balance the garment by taking in through both the sides and centre back. This methods allows for more to be taken out the waist without compromising the structure.

subservices.name: Take in waist through darts
subservices.description: This methods provides more curve to the seat area. This will leave two dart lines on the back of your jeans underneath where the pockets sit.

services.name: Shorten
services.description: Reduces the length of your skirt from the hem while maintaining the original finish and shape where possible. Please select a premium service for skirt with delicate fabrics as these require extra time and care from our tailors. Please be aware that any original vent features (i.e. openings at the back of the dress) can not be replicated with this service.

questions.question: Does your skirt have any unique details?
questions.explainer: Does your skirt have sequins, zips or any details that will need to be removed and re-attached to complete this?

questions.question: Is your skirt denim?
Does your skirt have lining?
Does your skirt have pleats?
questions.explainer: Recreating the pleated hem of a skirt can be challenging, as pleats are typically formed using specialised machinery. Our skilled tailors will hand-press the pleats into the new hem with precision, though there may be slight variations from the original finish.

subservices.name: Take in sides
subservices.description: Reduces the width through the back seams to create a more flattering look, this can be altered by a maximum of 2 inches. Please note, any original vent features (i.e. openings at the back of the jacket) will not be replicated with this service.

What is the size of the rip

subservices.name: Patch
subservices.description: whenever possible fabric will be harvested from the garment, alternatively a close match will be sourced. Like for like cannot be guaranteed.

subservices.name: Visible darning
subservices.description: visible mending technique

subservices.name: Fix rip along seam
subservices.description: Repairs a single tear or damage along a seam, where the pieces of fabric are stitched together. Ideal for small rips caused by snagging or wear and tear to maintain the structural integrity of your garment. In some cases depending on the damage we will need to take in the fabric to ensure a clean new durable seam, this can slightly alter the fit of the original skirt shape.

services.name: Replace buttons / poppers
services.description: replacement with similar ones. Like for like cannot be guaranteed.

subservices.description: Adding a panel of material to the side seams, in a contrasting or matching fabric colour. We recommend to send in a matched item of the same style and fabric for our tailors to match the measurements to.

questions.question: What material would you like for the panels?
questions.explainer: We can either use material you supply or use what we have in the studio. This can be a close match in terms of material colour and fabric or a contrast colour.

questions.question: How many holes/ rips would you like mending?
What is the size of the rip
questions.explainer: Please give the average size of the holes or rips when there are varying sizes. Please measure from the widest part.

questions.question: Are your trousers patterned?

subservices.name: Visible darning
subservices.description: We will use yarn or thin thread depending on the material of your garment we match the yarn as close as possible to the original colour and darn the hole.

subservices.name: Patch
subservices.description: We can create a discreet patch using excess material from the inner part of the sleeve or pockets. Or alternatively we can use a close match material if there is not excess material in your garment.

subservices.name: Create discrete seam
subservices.description: We can pull the rip/ hole into a small seam leaving a small line where the material has been taken in to find the damage.

subservices.name: Fix rip along seam
subservices.description: Repairs a single tear or damage along a seam, where the pieces of fabric are stitched together. Ideal for small rips caused by snagging or wear and tear to maintain the structural integrity of your garment. In some cases depending on the damage we will need to take in the fabric to ensure a clean new durable seam, this can slightly alter the fit of the original skirt shape.

services.name: Zip replacement
services.description: Ideal for when your zipper is damaged, stuck or no longer functions correctly. We have a stock of standard zips and can not guarantee an exact match to the original.

services.name: Fix loose stitching
services.description: Repairs seams or stitches that have come undone or are loose. Ideal for when the thread holding the fabric together is damaged, loose, or has unraveled.

questions.question: Does you pocket have a hole or rip along seam?
How many belt loops need fixing?

services.name: Shorten Sleeves
services.description: Reduces the sleeve length  while maintaining the original finish and shape where possible.

questions.question: Do the sleeves of your blouse have any unique finish you would like re-creating?
questions.explainer: If the cuff detail has buttons, zips , embellishments or a vent we will recreate this finish.

services.name: Crop
services.description: Reduces the length while maintaining the original finish and shape where possible.

questions.question: Does your blouse have lining?

services.name: Take in from Sides
services.description: Reduces the width through the side seams, this can be altered by usually a maximum of 2 inches to ensure a balance in the overall shape.

questions.question: Does your Blouse have lining?

What type of zip needs replacing?

questions.question: Would you prefer a close colour match or a contrast? Please specify 'close match' or your desired contrast colour.
questions.explainer: If you choose close colour match we will select the closest match from our selection of over 2000 yarns. We cannot guarantee an exact match.

subservices.name: Patch
subservices.description: We can create patches using either excess material from the garment or use a close colour match to create discrete patches. Alternatively we can create patches in a contrast colour similar to the style of Sashiko mending techniques.

subservices.name: Create discrete seam
subservices.description: We can pull the rip/ hole into a small seam leaving a small line where the material has been taken in to find the damage.

Ideal for small rips caused by snagging or wear and tear to maintain the structural integrity of your garment. services.name: Up-size
services.description: Increase the width or length of your garment

questions.question: Would you like your garment lengthened or made wider?
Is there seam allowance?
questions.explainer: Check the inside seam for extra fabric on the inside of a garment, found along the seams where the fabric pieces are stitched together.

subservices.name: Add side panels to widen
subservices.description: Adding a panel of fabric into the side seams, in a contrasting or matching fabric colour. We recommend to send in a matched item of the same style and fabric for our tailors to match the measurements to.

subservices.name: Add Panel to hem to lengthen
subservices.description: Adding a panel of fabric to hem, in a contrasting or matching fabric colour. We recommend to send in a matched item of the same style and fabric for our tailors to match the measurements to.

subservices.name: Widen using existing seam allowance
subservices.description: Discrete method of widening using existing seam allowance to let out the sides. Please keep in mind that previous stitch marks my be visible when first completed but this will fade with wear and washes.

subservices.name: Lengthen using existing seam allowance
subservices.description: Discrete method of lengthening by letting down the existing seam. Please keep in mind that previous stitch marks my be visible when first completed but this will fade with wear and washes.

services.name: Shorten Sleeves
services.description: Reduces the sleeve length  while maintaining the original finish and shape where possible.

questions.explainer: If your shirt has a unique finish such as buttons, zips or embellishment we will have to recreate this finish
